Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] Problem enabling Use Fast Development" (#3335) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
cant emulate my android project when enabling `Use Fast Development`.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Enable `Use Fast Development`
2. Rebuild
3. Run on my samsung s9 edge

### Expected Behavior
the app should start on the mobile
### Actual Behavior
the app start and then shutdown directly without any errors.
as for visual studio, the emulator stop
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.1.0.555618
- Last known good version: hmm dont remember really, i think 4.0.0.425677
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - Android: 9.0
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: samsung s9 edge

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Crash while using kotlinx-couroutine " (#3348) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

We have created a binding from a AAR file that has kotlinx-couroutine as one of its dependency. While creating the binding the dependency is added as below.
    <EmbeddedReferenceJar Include="Jars\kotlinx-coroutines-android-1.1.1.jar" />

The app that uses the binding builds fine and on launch it crashes with the below exception.


[AndroidRuntime] FATAL EXCEPTION: main
[AndroidRuntime] Process: com.airwatch.xamarinsampleapp, PID: 20262
[AndroidRuntime] java.lang.IllegalStateException: Module with the Main dispatcher is missing. Add dependency providing the Main dispatcher, e.g. 'kotlinx-coroutines-android'
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.internal.MissingMainCoroutineDispatcher.missing(MainDispatchers.kt:73)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.internal.MissingMainCoroutineDispatcher.isDispatchNeeded(MainDispatchers.kt:54)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.DispatchedKt.resumeCancellable(Dispatched.kt:373)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.intrinsics.CancellableKt.startCoroutineCancellable(Cancellable.kt:25)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.CoroutineStart.invoke(CoroutineStart.kt:109)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.AbstractCoroutine.start(AbstractCoroutine.kt:160)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.BuildersKt__Builders_commonKt.launch(Builders.common.kt:54)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.BuildersKt.launch(Unknown Source:1)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.BuildersKt__Builders_commonKt.launch$default(Builders.common.kt:47)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at kotlinx.coroutines.BuildersKt.launch$default(Unknown Source:1)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.sample.core.compliance.ComplianceExecutor$Companion.runTaskParallel(ComplianceExecutor.kt:30)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.sample.core.compliance.ComplianceManager.executeTask(ComplianceManager.kt:61)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.sample.core.compliance.AWComplianceHelper.executeRestrictions(Unknown Source:74)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.sample.sdk.context.state.processor.SDKStateProcessor.onConfigurationChanged(Unknown Source:34)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.sample.sdk.configuration.BaseConfigurationImpl.notifyPreferenceListeners(Unknown Source:33)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.sample.sdk.configuration.BaseConfigurationImpl.lambda$notifyPreferenceListeners$0$BaseConfigurationImpl(Unknown Source:0)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.sample.sdk.configuration.BaseConfigurationImpl$$Lambda$0.run(Unknown Source:6)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:883)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:100)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:214)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:7319)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(RuntimeInit.java:492)
[AndroidRuntime] 	at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:934)
[Process] Sending signal. PID: 20262 SIG: 9




Visual Studio :
=== Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 for Mac ===

Version 8.1.5 (build 9)

**Additional information:**

Seems that Xamarin build process is not taking care of copying kotlinx-coroutines files.
We assume this can be fixed by copying the files from original/META-INF to the APK dir’s META-INF folder. The following files should be excluded though: *.MF,* .SF, *.RSA.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests/ci] Add MSBuild test stage to Azure Pipelines" (#3347) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
* Adds a new `mac_msbuild_tests` job to `azure-pipelines.yaml` to run the msbuild tests. This is still a work in progress, we still need to consider commercial and device test execution, as well as better parallelization and Windows execution.

* Appends relevant build log file paths to the test result xml rather than dumping the full log to the test output. It's a bit painful to scroll through diagnostic build output to see which tests failed. This _should_ allow relevant log files to be uploaded directly as attachments to the tests, improving the Azure Pipeline test failure investigation story.

* Adds a new `TestAgainstSystemInstall` property and `TESTINSTALLER` compiler constant to allow for better control of behavior for projects which import `Configuration.props`.

* Removes the dependency on the generated `XABuildPaths.cs` file when building against a system installation. We may want to similarly replace this file in other places with something that doesn't require xaprepare execution.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] [Android] Swipe gestures don't work on page with ListView" (#6863) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
[Android] Swipe gesture events don't fire when page has ListView.
iOS & UWP work fine

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create new Xam Forms project with MasterDetail template and update nugets
2. Add SwipeGestureRecognizer's to the ItemsPage StackLayout
3. Swiped events don't fire on Android

### Expected Behavior
Swipe events should fire on Android as it does on other platforms

### Actual Behavior
Swipe events don't fire on Android 

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Latest VS & Xamarin & nugets

[Xam.Swipey.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3387832/Xam.Swipey.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[XM]mmp throws an error mono.framework mdk is missing on building installer in Catalina with XM preview build" (#6578) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce
1.  Build Installer project  on macOS10.15 beta3 with Xcode11 beta 3 installed
### Expected Behavior
Installer project should build successfully
### Actual Behavior
Installer build fails with an error MMP : error MM5202: Mono.framework MDK is missing. Please install the MDK for your Mono.framework version from https://www.mono-project.com/download/
### Environment
https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/48f78ed39b36bda2920f6539b8b4923a
### Build Logs
Build Log: 

Command Line: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/GouriKumari/d050aa7db2600972f20de45e5bdffdb9/raw/25f4e8ffae0f74547cb37b872abe087ae897dc7e/gistfile1.txt

IDE: https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/9acfd99355dec69a67a5a19559b9043f#file-gistfile1-txt-L1041
### Example Project (If Possible)
https://github.com/xamarin/installer/blob/master/XamarinInstaller.Mac.sln

### Additional Behaviour:
Installer build and launched successfully with preview builds on Mojave, https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/37f1057a246f9787d5d9427a2913f234

Test Env: https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/047280158693ce66c962a33b96e5fd6c

Events.RelatedBody:
Beside quite some (availability/macros) noise, there's only a single
new API according to the header files - however it's missing in the
binary.

Filed feedback https://feedbackassistant.apple.com/feedback/6644627
Tracked in https://github.com/xamarin/maccore/issues/1887
